stimulusHtml:
Researchers studying the relationship between sleep and memory obtained a sample of 28 adults to participate in an experiment. Half of the participants were randomly assigned to a full nightâ€™s sleep, and the other half were awakened every two hours throughout the night. The following day, the participants were given a list of words to memorize and recall after one hour. Researchers recorded the number of words recalled by each participant. The p-value of an appropriate statistical test was 0.29.

Which of the following is a reasonable conclusion?
choicesHtml: The data provide sufficient evidence that memory is related to sleep.
The data provide sufficient evidence that memory is not related to sleep.
A cause-and-effect relationship between memory and sleep cannot be established. However, the data provide sufficient evidence that there is an association between memory and sleep.
The data do not provide convincing evidence that memory is related to sleep.
The conditions for inference must not have been satisfied.
